subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Liberation Theology: Christ of the Poor
description: A micro-lesson that makes Liberation Theology: Christ of the Poor usable.

hook.text: Jesus was poor, lived among the poor, and championed the poor. Why does the Church side with the rich? Priests asked.

buildup.text: In 1960s Latin America, priests taught that God has a 'preferential option for the poor.' Liberation theology was born.

twist.text: The Vatican condemned parts of liberation theology as too Marxist. Pope Francis later embraced its core message.

climax.text: Liberation theology asked: whose side is God on? The answer ‚Äî the poor's ‚Äî remains Christianity's most radical claim.

punchline.text: God sides with the poor. Liberation theology made that claim unavoidable.

quiz.question: What is the core claim of liberation theology?
options: God has a preferential option for the poor
